column2: Use the examples in Exercise 1 to make sentences with prefer to ... rather than ... .
column3:
You can say:
She prefers going to the cinema to watching movies at home.
OR

She prefers {{c1::to}} {{c1::go}} {{c1::to the cinema}} {{c1::rather than}} {{c1::watch movies}} {{c1::at home}} (to the cinema / at home / to / rather than / go / watch movies).

column2: Use the examples in Exercise 1 to make sentences with prefer to ... rather than ... .
column3:
You can say:
He prefers being very busy to having nothing to do.
OR

He prefers {{c1::to}} {{c1::be}} {{c1::very busy}} {{c1::rather}} {{c1::than}} {{c1::have}} {{c1::nothing to do}} (have / than / be / to / nothing to do / very busy / rather).

column2: Use the examples in Exercise 1 to make sentences with prefer to ... rather than ... .
column3:
You can say:
She prefers working with other people to working on her own.
OR

She prefers {{c1::to}} {{c1::work}} {{c1::with other people}} {{c1::rather}} {{c1::than}} {{c1::on her own}} (rather / to / on her own / work / than / with other people).
